### PR summary [9f2c0773ce](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15255/commits/9f2c0773ce2b9a77c6c433ab1fef5ea4280288de)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`++-- ext`
`++-- map_bddAbove`
`++-- map_bddBelow`
`++-- mem_lowerBounds_image_self`
`++-- mem_upperBounds_image_self`
`-++- map_isGreatest`
`-++- map_isLeast`
`-++- mem_lowerBounds_image`
`--++ mem_upperBounds_image`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10154372043/job/28079369314)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10154372043/job/28079369608)

I'm surprised that you're deleting it here, instead of including it in all the theorems of the section. Is that because you're planning to `include Hf` or something like that? Note that there was a clear majority to say in #2452 that the global (per section) `include / omit` mechanism of Lean 3 was very bad for readability. I don't know if Sebastian is planning to put it in #4814, but if we can avoid it it would probably be better.

Yes, I had in mind to use `include`. When I've been working on lean-pr-testing-4814, I was inclined to use `include` once to got to beyond about 5 instances of `include in` or copy-pasting the variable.

But if we really want to avoid section level `include ...`, I am happy to do that!

In fact, it makes life somewhat easier, because we can backport more of the changes to `master` now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: backports for leanprover/lean4#4814 (part 4)
